document.masterDocTitle: The genus Eriastichus La Salle (Hymenoptera, Eulophidae, Tetrastichinae) in the Neotropical region, introducing 48 new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The genus Eriastichus La Salle (Hymenoptera, Eulophidae, Tetrastichinae) in the Neotropical region, introducing 48 new species

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Scientific Associate Biological Museum (Entomology), Lund University, Soelvegatan 37, SE- 22362 Lund, Sweden & Natural History Museum, Life Sciences, Cromwell Road, London, UK

subSubSection.paragraph: Eriastichus cigdemae La Salle 1994 : 173-174. Type species Eriastichus cigdemae La Salle.

Heavily setose species (Figs 1 , 2 , 5 , 6 ): head (including eyes), pronotum, mesoscutum, coxae, and lateral parts of propodeum (excl. bare median part - hairy only in
E. masneri
La Salle) +/- covered with fine, short setae; malar sulcus curved; base of scape oblique (e.g., Fig. 45 ); F1-F4 of male antenna with scattered setae of varying length (Figs 11 - 58 ), i.e., without a compact whorl of long setae attached close to base - a feature present in many tetrastichine groups; mesoscutellum transverse (Figs 5-6 ); dorsellum large, flat to slightly convex and smooth (Fig. 5 ); fore wing with postmarginal vein 0.3-0.7 x as long as the elongate and slender stigmal vein, wing disc strongly setose, including base (i.e., without speculum) and ventral surface of costal cell (Fig. 4 ), wings +/- uniformly but weakly infuscate (Fig. 4 ) but in a few species hyaline; gaster with pleural membrane between Gt1-4 and Gs1-4 inflated (Figs 1-3 , 7 , 8 ); both sexes with a tuft of pale and flattened setae laterally on Gt3-6 (Figs 7-10 ), though most species with tufts only on Gt6.

tr.td: Median propodeum hairy ( La Salle 1994 : fig. 30)

E. masneri
La Salle
(male unknown, this is an anticipated placement; not recorded from Costa Rica)

E. nakos
La Salle
(male unknown, this is an anticipated placement; not recorded from Costa Rica)
Scape 1.3-1.4 x as long as ventral plaque (Fig. 50 ); lower face yellowish brown (Fig. 59 )
Scape 1.7-8.0 x as long as ventral plaque; colour of lower face variable
Scape 5.3-8.0 x as long as ventral plaque
Scape 1.7-5.0 x as long as ventral plaque
Antenna with dorsobasal setae on F1 0.5 x as long as length of F1 (Fig. 15 ), pedicel + flagellum 2.0 x as long as width of head
Antenna with dorsobasal setae on F1 at least 1.1 x as long as length of F1, pedicel + flagellum at most 1.6 x as long as width of head
Scape 8.0 x as long as ventral plaque (Fig. 57 ), and 1.4 x as long as height of eye
Scape at most 6.7 x as long as ventral plaque, and at most 0.9 x as long as height of eye
Antennal flagellum longer (Fig. 11 ), e.g., F1 2.5 x , F4 2.8 x , clava 7.3 x as long as wide
Antennal flagellum shorter, F1 1.5-1.7 x , F4 2.0 x , clava 4.8-5.2 x as long as wide
Setae on flagellomeres more erect, and dorsobasal setae on F1 1.5 x as long as length of F1 (Fig. 12 )
Setae on flagellomeres less erect, and dorsobasal setae on F1 1.1 x as long as length of F1 (Fig. 16 )
Scape 1.3 x as long as height of eye (Fig. 14 )
Scape at most 1.0 x as long as height of eye
Scape dark brown
Scape yellowish brown to pale brown
Dorsobasal setae on F1 0.8-1.1 x as long as length of F1
Dorsobasal setae on F1 0.4-0.6 x as long as length of F1
Ventral plaque on scape situated below the middle (Figs 17 , 20 )
Each flagellomere with few setae, e.g., F1 with six setae, ventral plaque 0.2 x as long as length of scape (Fig. 17 )
Each flagellomere with more setae, e.g., F1 with ca. 15 setae, ventral plaque 0.4 x as long as length of scape (Fig. 20 )
Flagellomeres longer, F1, F3, F4 each 3.7 x , F2 4.0 x as long as wide (Fig. 18 )
Flagellomeres shorter, F1 2.0-3.5, F2 2.4-3.5, F3 2.1-3.4, F4 2.3-3.4 x as long as wide
Fore and mid legs with coxae and femora yellowish brown
Fore and mid legs with coxae and femora dark brown
Ventral plaque 0.5 x as long as length of scape (Fig. 22 )
Ventral plaque 0.3 x as long as length of scape (Fig. 23 )
Dorsobasal setae on F1 ca. 2 x as long as F1
Dorsobasal setae on F1 at most 1.5 x as long as F1
Dorsobasal setae on F1 at least 1.2 x as long as F1, and setae on flagellomeres erect (Figs 24 , 27 )
Dorsobasal setae on F1 at most 1.0 x as long as F1, setae on flagellomeres variable
Antenna shorter (Fig. 24 ), pedicel + flagellum 1.1 x as long as width of head
Antenna longer (Fig. 27 ), pedicel + flagellum 1.6-1.7 x as long as width of head
Scape 4.5-5.0 x as long as ventral plaque
Scape 1.8-4.2 x as long as ventral plaque
Ventral plaque situated below median part of scape
Dorsobasal setae on F1 0.6 x as long as length of F1 (Fig. 40 )
Dorsobasal setae on F1 0.9-1.0 x as long as length of F1 (Figs 28 , 31 )
Antenna with F1-F4 each 3.3-3.5 x as long as wide, setae on flagellomeres less erect (Fig. 31 )
Antenna with F1-F4 1.8-2.5 x as long as wide, setae on flagellomeres more erect (Fig. 28 )
Scape 1.7-2.0 x as long as ventral plaque
Scape 2.2-4.2 x as long as ventral plaque
Setae on flagellomeres less erect, scape yellowish brown to pale brown
Antenna with F1-F4 each 2.0 x and clava 4.3 x as long as wide (Fig. 21 )
Antenna with F1-F4 each 2.7-3.0 x and clava 5.5-6.3 x as long as wide (Figs 13 , 30 )
Frons and legs yellowish brown
Frons partly to completely dark brown, legs yellowish brown to dark brown
Coxae and femora predominantly to completely dark brown
Coxae and femora +/- yellowish brown, some coxae or hind femur can be partly dark brown
Setae on flagellomeres erect (Figs 34 , 58 )
Setae on flagellomeres less erect than in alternate (Figs 33 , 56 )
Scape 3.5-4.2 x as long as ventral plaque
Scape 2.2-3.1 x as long as ventral plaque
Dorsobasal setae on F1 0.5-0.6 x as long as F1 (Figs 32 , 36 )
Dorsobasal setae on F1 0.8-1.0 x as long as F1 (Figs 39 , 41 )
Ventral plaque situated below middle of scape
Ventral plaque situated in the middle, or slightly above the middle
Scape 2.2-2.5 x as long as ventral plaque
Scape 2.8-3.1 x as long as ventral plaque
Dorsobasal setae on F1 1.0 x as long as F1 (Fig. 44 )
Dorsobasal setae on F1 0.5-0.6 x as long as F1 (Fig. 42 )
F2-F4 each 2.3 x as long as wide (Fig. 26 )
F2-F4 each at least 3.0 x as long as wide
Flagellomeres longer, e.g., F2 3.6-3.8 x as long as wide (Figs 38 , 43 )
Flagellomeres shorter, F2 3.0-3.2 x as long as wide
Dorsobasal setae on F1 0.9 x as long as F1 (Fig. 43 )
Dorsobasal setae on F1 0.6 x as long as F1 (Fig. 38 )
Dorsobasal setae on F1 0.5 x as long as F1, scape dark brown (Fig. 46 )
Dorsobasal setae on F1 0.9 x as long as F1, scape yellowish brown (Fig. 49 )
Dorsobasal setae on F1 0.5 x as long as F1 and pedicel + flagellum 1.9 x as long as width of head
Dorsobasal setae on F1 at least 0.6 x as long as F1 and/or pedicel + flagellum at most 1.7 x as long as width of head
Dorsobasal setae on F1 0.4 x as long as F1 (Fig. 35 ) and pedicel + flagellum 1.7 x as long as width of head
Dorsobasal setae on F1 0.6-1.0 x as long as F1, if dorsobasal setae on F1 is only 0.6 x as long as F1, then pedicel + flagellum are 1.5 x as long as width of head
Antennal flagellum long and slender (Fig. 54 ), e.g., F4 3.4 x and clava 7.6 x as long as wide
F4 2.2-2.8 x and clava 4.8-6.3 x as long as wide

Dorsobasal setae on F1-F4 0.6-0.8 x as long as funicular segment it is attached to
Antennal flagellum more slender (Fig. 53 ), e.g., F3 3.0 x and clava 6.3 x as long as wide

Pedicel + flagellum 1.5-1.7 x as long as width of head
